applicability_reasoning: This regulation does not apply to the provided pension scheme rules document for several reasons: 1) The document is a set of pension scheme rules that governs how a company pension life cover scheme operates, not a document about intermediary appointments or business requirements. 2) The document shows this is a direct product from AIB Life (as evidenced by the footer showing Saol Assurance d.a.c. trading as AIB Life), not an intermediary arrangement. 3) The scheme rules detail a direct relationship between the employer, trustee, and AIB Life as the life office, with no mention of intermediaries being involved in the distribution. 4) The regulation specifically applies to regulated entities requiring business levels from intermediaries, which is not relevant to these pension scheme rules that establish the legal framework for providing death benefits to employees.
regulation_title: No specified level of consumer business to be required of intermediary in order to retain appointment
regulation_text: 25. (1) A regulated entity shall not require an intermediary to provide a specified level of business from consumers in order to retain an appointment from that regulated entity. (2) This Regulation applies only to a regulated entity that distributes its products to consumers through an intermediary. 44 [81]
source_name: CENTRAL BANK (SUPERVISION AND ENFORCEMENT) ACT 2013 (SECTION 48) (CONSUMER PROTECTION) REGULATIONS 2025
